New Records: The referee showed 18 cards in total, two red and 16 yellow, to set a new Euros record.
Key Match Events: Hakan Çalhanoglu scored with a low shot across goalkeeper Jindrich Stanek
Tomás Soucek prodded home in the 66th minute after a long throw caused chaos
Cenk Tosun struck Turkey's winner in stoppage time
Post-Match Reflections: Shaka Hislop believes the referee played a massive part in Czechia's loss to Turkey and says it may have cost them a place in the round of 16.
Captain Tomás Soucek lamented how the 'disrespectful' soft red card had affected the game.
Turkey defender Mert Muldur said, 'We all fought very well together'
Turkey winger Baris Alper Yilmaz said, 'We are very happy.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Turkish fans outnumbered Czech fans due to their large diaspora in Germany
Thirty-year-old playmaker Calhanoglu's 50th-minute goal was a first at his third Euros
The Czechs finished bottom of the group with one point.
